meanings.definition: The quality or state of having options or choices.
meanings.sent1: Having optionality allows us to make decisions based on what we want.
meanings.sent2: In life, having optionality is important for personal freedom.
meanings.sent3: When faced with a menu full of optionality, I always struggle to pick just one dish.
meanings.sent4: The concept of optionality is like having a colorful palette of choices to paint your life with.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of optionality is that it opens up a world of possibilities.

meanings.definition: The ability to choose between different possibilities.
meanings.sent1: Optionality in career paths allows individuals to explore various opportunities.
meanings.sent2: Having optionality in investments can help mitigate risks.
meanings.sent3: I find the optionality of choosing between ice cream flavors quite delightful.
meanings.sent4: The idea of optionality is akin to having a diverse toolbox for problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: The true power of optionality lies in the freedom to make choices without constraints.
